body:

[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
```

**Current behavior**
<!-- Describe how the bug manifests. -->
Links on the [Projects](https://github.com/angular/angular/projects) page of Angular Github repository don't open relevant pages. For example, if you click on **go/ng-priorities**, it leads nowhere.

**Expected behavior**
<!-- Describe what the behavior would be without the bug. -->
Links should open the correct page.

**Browser:**
<!-- All browsers where this could be reproduced -->
All.

title: fix(forms): setValue/patchValue updates control only when value has changed
body: Closes #13835

title: fix(router): RouterLink mirrors input `target` as attribute
body: Closes #13837 Description: When we use input binding ``` Failing 1 ``` the actual dom element doesn't have `target` attribute this is why the link doesn't open in a new tab.

title: Link is opened in the same tab, when target="_blank" is set using binding
body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION WE MIGHT CLOSE YOUR ISSUE WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->

**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[x] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ ] feature request
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
```

**Current behavior**
<!-- Describe how the bug manifests. -->

When `target="_blank"` is set using data binding (e.g. `[target]="'_blank'"`) it doesn't open url in a new tab.

**Expected behavior**
<!-- Describe what the behavior would be without the bug. -->

When `target="_blank"` is set using data binding (e.g. `[target]="'_blank'"`) it opens url in a new tab, same as if `target` was set without using binding.

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
<!--
If the current behavior is a bug or you can illustrate your feature request better with an example, 
please provide the *STEPS TO REPRODUCE* and if possible a *MINIMAL DEMO* of the problem via
https://plnkr.co or similar (you can use this template as a starting point: http://plnkr.co/edit/tpl:AvJOMERrnz94ekVua0u5).
-->

Example: http://plnkr.co/edit/wCtDliPgWr3khL3NwCD3?p=preview

When clicking on "Working" it correctly opens link in a new tab.
When clicking on "Failing X" it loads new link in the same tab.

Example from plunker doesn't make sense. It just demonstrates issue. In real application I'm getting `target` value from another place and want to use binding to set it.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
<!-- Describe the motivation or the concrete use case -->

Broken?

**Please tell us about your environment:**
<!-- Operating system, IDE, package manager, HTTP server, ... -->

* **Angular version:** 2.4.1
<!-- Check whether this is still an issue in the most recent Angular version -->

* **Browser:** all
<!-- All browsers where this could be reproduced -->
 
* **Language:** all

* **Node (for AoT issues):** not relevant

title: Forms: Need setValue(obj, {ifNotEqual:true})
body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[ ] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ x ] feature request
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
```

**Current behavior**
<!-- Describe how the bug manifests. -->
When calling `setValue` or `patchValue` on a `FormGroup` (basically this is valid for any Form Control Element), it will call `setValue` for every child even if the value of some input didn't change. 
This will cause the cursor position and selection inside `<input>` elements to be reset. 

**Expected behavior**
<!-- Describe what the behavior would be without the bug. -->
There should be some option provided (like `ifNotEqual:true`) to only call `setValue` of those Form Controls where the value actually changed.

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
<!--
If the current behavior is a bug or you can illustrate your feature request better with an example, 
please provide the *STEPS TO REPRODUCE* and if possible a *MINIMAL DEMO* of the problem via
https://plnkr.co or similar (you can use this template as a starting point: http://plnkr.co/edit/tpl:AvJOMERrnz94ekVua0u5).
-->

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
<!-- Describe the motivation or the concrete use case -->
I have a big form with lot's of `<input>` fields. And there's a background job which updated the form while the user can enter data.
When this happens every selection within those `<input>` elements will get reset and the cursor position will be set to the end of the input element's value.

Currently I'm thinking about writing a custom method which does a diff of the form's current value and the new value. Then throw away every field with equal values and then use `form.patchValue`.
But it would be so much easier if Angular would provide this feature.

**Please tell us about your environment:**
<!-- Operating system, IDE, package manager, HTTP server, ... -->
MacOS Sierra, VS Code, NPM, Webpack, ...

* **Angular version:** 2.0.X
<!-- Check whether this is still an issue in the most recent Angular version -->
Angular 4.0.0 beta 2

* **Browser:** [all | Chrome XX | Firefox XX | IE XX | Safari XX | Mobile Chrome XX | Android X.X Web Browser | iOS XX Safari | iOS XX UIWebView | iOS XX WKWebView ]
<!-- All browsers where this could be reproduced -->
all 

* **Language:** [all | TypeScript X.X | ES6/7 | ES5]
TypeScript 2.1.4

* **Node (for AoT issues):** `node --version` =   
7.3.0

title: Custom module loading error
body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[X] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ ] feature request
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
```

**Current behavior**
I have updated my Angular 2.1.2 application to Angular 2.4.1 this week (and 2.4.2 this morning).  It took quite a few updates, but everything actually works in the browser now.

There is a module loading error in the console though.  The module (and components in it) work fine in the running app in the browser.  There is just this error in the console.

```
ERROR in Could not resolve "app/application-event/application-event.module" from "/Users/bobby/workspace/myapp/src/app/app.module.ts".
```

`application-event.module` is one of my custom modules that I try to load from my app root module `app.module`.

If I actually completely remove `application-event.module` from my application, I get a similar error in console for the next custom module I attempt to load.  Once again, the module and components in it work fine in the running app, just the error in the console.

**Expected behavior**
It appears everything works great in the running app.  So, I don't understand why this error is output in the console and/or how to get rid of it.  I don't want to say to the other developers on my team "just ignore that error in console"

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
I don't have a sample outside of my application, but can put one together if needed.  Just thought I'd see if there is something obvious I'm missing first since the app works and it's just an error in the console.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
Just an error in the console.

**Please tell us about your environment:**
OSX Sierra, Angular-CLI

* **Angular version:** 2.4.1
 
* **Language:** [TypeScript 2.0]

* **Node (for AoT issues):** `node --version` = v7.4.0

title: feat(forms): update validity on touched
body:
closes #7113

**Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements**
- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

I'm not sure if adding tests or changing the docs is necessary for this change, let me know.


**What kind of change does this PR introduce?**
- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

**What is the current behavior?**
https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/7113
The current behavior is that validators are only called when form values change.



**What is the new behavior?**
Validators are called onTouched (onBlur).



**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?**
- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


**Other information**:
Running validators onTouched (onBlur), allows a validators that only run once the user has moved on to the next input.

For example:
```typescript
export function trim(control: AbstractControl): {[key: string]: any} {
	if (control.touched && String(control.value).match(/^\s+|\s+$/)) {
		control.setValue(String(control.value).replace(/^\s+|\s+$/, ''));
		control.markAsUntouched();
	}
	return null;
}
```

title: Hybrid app(UpgradeModule) using angular router doesn't invoke change detection on initial load
body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[X] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ ] feature request
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
```

**Current behavior**
When
* bootstrap hybrid app using angular2 router
* On initial load of application, Change detetction doesn't call ngOnChanges on change of input binding which suppose to get data via async filter.  for e.g.
 `<test [testData]="data | async"></test>`
this happens only with initial load of  hybrid app routing and If we move to another route and again back to first route then ngOnChanges works fine.


**Expected behavior**
It should fire changeDetection whenever input binding(with async) changes. 

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
See this plunker with issue http://plnkr.co/edit/QUOLzNXYgDoTjeJ9iCiA?p=preview  
        **Steps**
  * Check testData on home page, it doesn't get updated 
  * Now click on user link and again click on home link, you'll see testData is changing and ngOnChanges logs data in console.

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
Use hybrid app with angular2 routing

**Please tell us about your environment:**
* **Angular version:** <= 2.4.0 
* **Browser:** [all | Chrome 55 | IE 10]
* **Language:** [TypeScript 2.0.3]

title: router and route instance are null on page refresh inside router.events.subscribe(...) method
body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")
```
[x] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ ] feature request
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
```

**Current behavior**
1. My enduser saves the link: www.domain.com/#/projects/1/tests as favorite link.
2. He pasts the link into the url bar and the page load starts.
3. The project with id 1 is not pre-selected in the dropdown of projects.
4. But the related tests data is loaded into the UI.
5. The UI  was put into an inconsistent broken state!

**Expected behavior**
1. My enduser saves the link: www.domain.com/#/projects/1/tests as favorite link.
2. He pasts the link into the url bar and the page load starts.
3. In the router.events.subscribe method I do: 

```
console.log('router', this.router.routerState.root.firstChild.firstChild && this.router.routerState.root.firstChild.firstChild.snapshot.params);
```

To get the current projects id. 
4. Then I search in the dropdown of projects for an project object with that id.
5. If that id exists set it as selected.
6. If that id does not exist make a redirect to the root path

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
https://plnkr.co/edit/qTjftING3Hk2fwN36bQa?p=preview

These are the steps how to edit the url bar of a plunkr, because you need to do that, to be able to reproduce the buggy behavior:

```
1. Load the plunkr and activate window mode
2. In window mode copy/paste the url into a new tab
3. When that is the pasted url: https://run.plnkr.co/LhwcQjzWHsRUda8H/projects/1/tests
4. Make it that url: https://run.plnkr.co/LhwcQjzWHsRUda8H/#/projects/1/tests
and change param: https://run.plnkr.co/LhwcQjzWHsRUda8H/#/projects/2/tests
5. If you dont add the hash then you get a not found 404.
```

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
This is actually already described above, this seems redundant to me.

**Please tell us about your environment:**
<!-- Operating system, IDE, package manager, HTTP server, ... -->
Win 10 x64, VS Code Editor, npm v4.0.5

* **Angular version:** 2.4.1 

* **Browser:** all  
 
* **Language:** all 

* **Node (for AoT issues):** `node --version` =   6.2.2

title: trackBy in *ngFor not working in <select>?
body:
**I'm submitting a ...**
```
[x] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
```

**Current behavior**
When using ngModel and trackBy in `<select>` the initial value is not selected when it is an object. 

**Expected behavior**
Initial value should be selected.

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
HTML:

```
<select [(ngModel)]="selectedItem">
    <option *ngFor="let item of items; trackBy:itemIdentity" [value]="item">
      {{item.name}}
   </option>
</select>
```

TS:
```
private items = [{id: 0, name: 'first'}, {id: 1, name: 'second'}];
private selectedItem = {id: 1, name: 'second'};

itemIdentity(index:number, item:any):any {
   return item.id;
}
```



* **Angular version:** 2.4.1
* **Browser:** Chrome
* **Language:** TypeScript X.X

title: docs(release-schedule): add release schedule doc
body:
This document requires Anguler DevRel approval before it can be merged.

As part of this document I'm proposing pushing off 4.0.0 release by one week by adding one more RC week (compared to the original plan). This will give community more time to test the release before we call it done and report any potential regression or unforeseen issues.

title: Angular Universal Roadmap for Angular 4.0
body:
### Migrate Angular Universal API to @angular/platform-server

## High Level Plan
Angular Universal consists of 1)API and 2)tools to do server side rendering of Angular apps. Currently both the Angular Universal API and tools live in angular/universal. The plan is to migrate the API part of Angular Universal to the core Angular project in angular/angular for the Angular 4.0 release and beyond.

We will design the API from ground up to be a core part of Angular and also refactor internals of Angular to better support Angular Universal. The aim is to build a strong foundation for the future development of Angular Universal. This also puts Angular Universal as a core part of Angular and will follow the same quality and release processes as the rest of Angular.

We will keep the API compatible with the current Express wrapper for Universal and make corresponding changes to it as needed. (We haven't scoped out the support for other Universal tools outside of the Express wrapper at this point)

There will be API docs and Dev Guide for Angular Universal. There will be a migration doc to help with migration from the current angular2-universal to the new Angular Universal API.

## Use cases
The main use cases we are considering for this iteration of Universal are

- Initial rendering of Angular application on server for perceived faster loading of application
- SEO: Content in Angular application is indexed by crawlers
- Link Preview - Generate a preview of the angular application for link previews on different websites

## API (Work in Progress - To be finalized)
Instead of having a separate Angular platform to support the Universal API we aim to augment the `platformServer` in `@angular/platform-server` which already provides the basic support for running Angular in Node.js environment. 

The primary addition will be the `renderModuleFactory` API to platformServer to serialize a module to a string. Very roughly the usage of this API would look like -

```js
import {platformServer} from @angular/platform-server;
import {AppServerModuleNgFactory} from ./server.ngfactory;

platformServer({
  document: <html>...</html>,  // The full document from an index.html
  url: http://host.com/application/route,
}).renderModuleFactory(AppServerModuleNgFactory).then(html => ...);
```

where the platformServer will now take in the the options for initializing - A document string which represents the whole document from what would be the index.html on the client side app and the current app URL.

The other main addition will be the `ServerModule` in `@angular/platform-server` that corresponds to the `BrowserModule` in the client side. We recommend that you have a separate top-level App Browser Module and an App Server Module where you specify your platform specific providers including `BrowserModule` and `ServerModule` respectively.

Open issue: Do we provide a way to pass in the request data to the server side Angular application in the first iteration?

## Implementation details

- Keep the current implementation of the renderer in `platformServer` and make changes to it as needed to support Universal use cases.

- Refactor Http module to be platform independent and move the platform dependent parts into platformBrowser and platformServer.

- Provide a server side Location service.

- Make the new [Metatags service](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/modules/@angular/platform-browser/src/browser/meta.ts) platform agnostic and move it to @angular/common so that server side applications can manipulate metatags required for link preview.

- We will make the server implementation of Http(most probably based on XHR2) on the server platform to be Zone aware. We will provide guidelines on how to make other asynchronous Node libraries Zone aware - so that the server side application knows when the rendering is actually complete.

- Provide a way to test Universal ready Components and Application. We already run all internal Angular tests in the Node environment. We will provide helper utilities to make it easier to test your Universal ready Components on both Node and browser.

- Update the Universal starter to use the new API


Thanks,
Vikram Subramanian and Alex Rickabaugh

title: [4.x] Don't allow injecting classes without @Injectable
body:
- `Injectable` or any sub classes,
- Should be deprecated in 4.x, remove in the next major release,
- As of now it is possible when the ctor has no arguments or if any other decorator is applied.

title: [4.x Cleanup] Remove Renderer.invokeElementMethod, as Angular does not use it!
body:
The `invokeElementMethod` of the renderer is not used in Angular.

It should be removed in the 4.x branch

title: chore(ci): validate the message of each new commit during ci

body: fixes #13796

title: fix(upgrade): detect async downgrade component changes
body:
This commit effectively reverts 7e0f02f96e59863dff563cb7036c21aa58220a67
as it was an invalid fix for #6385, that created a more significant
bug, which was that changes were not always being detected.

Angular 1 digests should be run inside the ngZone to ensure
that async changes are detected.

We don't know how to fix #6385 without breaking change detection
at this stage. That issue is triggered by async operations, such as
`setTimeout`, being triggered inside scope watcher functions.

One could argue that watcher functions should be pure and not do
work such as triggering async operations. It is possible that the
original use case could be supported by moving the debounce
logic into the watch listener function, which is only called if the
watched value actually changes.

Closes #10660, #12318, #12034

It is possible that this revert could be considered a breaking change since
the previous bug is now apparent again.

The same fix will need to be done on `upgrade/static` as well, once this is approved.

title: Static upgrade instantiates upgraded services too soon - $injector not yet available
body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION WE MIGHT CLOSE YOUR ISSUE WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->

**I'm submitting a ...**
```
[X ] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[ ] feature request
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
```

**Current behavior**
<!-- Describe how the bug manifests. -->
Factory for upgraded services is called before angular 1 is initialized - $injector is passed as undefined to the factory.

**Expected behavior**
<!-- Describe what the behavior would be without the bug. -->
Angular should instantiate services later when $injector is available.

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**
<!--
If the current behavior is a bug or you can illustrate your feature request better with an example, 
please provide the *STEPS TO REPRODUCE* and if possible a *MINIMAL DEMO* of the problem via
https://plnkr.co or similar (you can use this template as a starting point: http://plnkr.co/edit/tpl:AvJOMERrnz94ekVua0u5).
-->

There are multiple scenarios which trigger this bug.

1. Service having ngOnInit lifecycle method. When you put it on a ng2 service that injects upgraded services, factory for this upgraded service is called sooner (during bootstrapModule, not in upgrade.bootstrap as it should, so $injector is not available).

https://plnkr.co/edit/ocxuE39B7Aci8wmSNEJJ

2. When we inject an upgraded service into a downgraded service and inject that downgraded service into a run() block, then the upgraded service is constructed with $injector still undefined.

https://plnkr.co/edit/eq8VXrAnMWExTDdZJEF6

3. When $http is used during an early phase (like with angular translate downloading translation files), then a service is also instantiated with $injector undefined.

config(function($httpProvider) { $httpProvider.interceptors.push(function(MyService) {...}) }));

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
<!-- Describe the motivation or the concrete use case -->

When upgrading a slightly bigger project, it often contains a lot of config or run blocks. Sooner or later this issue is triggered.

**Please tell us about your environment:**
<!-- Operating system, IDE, package manager, HTTP server, ... -->

* **Angular version:** Tested both angular 2.4.1 and 4.0.0-beta.2, both are broken.

* **Browser:** Chrome 55 | Firefox 45 | maybe others
<!-- All browsers where this could be reproduced -->
 
* **Language:** at least TypeScript 2.0 transpiled to ES5

* **Node (for AoT issues):** `node --version` =   6.9.3

title: Router: Query params are removed when using preserveQueryParams
body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION WE MIGHT CLOSE YOUR ISSUE WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->

**Current behavior**
On a routerLink, if `queryParams` and `preserveQueryParams` are used together, the query parameters are not adding to the routerLink.

Query params are still added to the href even if preserveQueryParams is set.

Note the two links
The first link has no preserveQueryParams set, and hovering over the link shows a query string of `?filter=true`
The second link has preserveQueryParams set, and hovering over the link shows no query params.

title: ngSwitchCase does not allow expressions starting with '-'
body:
**I'm submitting a ...** (check one with "x") ``` [x] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting [ ] feature request [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question ``` **Current behavior** ngSwitchCase does not allow an expression that beings with a '-', meaning negative numbers have to be expressed as '0-x'. **Expected behavior** ngSwitchCase should accept expressions beginning with -. **Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions** http://plnkr.co/edit/d7fqKxv3WOh0oJl0VRqQ
Test is zero. Test is -1.
**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?** Accepting expressions that would be accepted by a regular switch statement is more intuitive than having to workaround with 0-x for negative numbers. * **Angular version:** 2.4.1 * **Browser:** all * **Language:** all

title: chore(animations): fix internal jscompiler issue and AOT quoting
Nested attribute translation in a translation not applied
body: **I'm submitting a ...** (check one with "x") ``` [X] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting [ ] feature request [ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question ``` **Current behavior** In the following example: `I don't output any element` The translation of title is not applied. If I remove the i18n from the ng-container it works. **Expected behavior** The translation on i18n-title should be applied **Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions** I adjusted the plnkr from the i18n doc: https://plnkr.co/edit/8P92XurVX81eqUoeFfUx?p=preview **What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?** I need to translate the attributes * **Browser:** [all | Chrome XX | Firefox XX | IE XX | Safari XX | Mobile Chrome XX | Android X.X Web Browser | iOS XX Safari | iOS XX UIWebView | iOS XX WKWebView ] Chrome Version 52.0.2743.82 (64-bit)
